history.content:
The deadline to change the grading option is September 25th. You can still change it later, but you have to fill in a form and specify the reason why you want to change the grading option after the deadline. 

Source: http://registrar.berkeley.edu/Records/adddrop.html

(The form part may not be entirely accurate, here's what the engineering website http://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/deadlines says)

"Students are able to change their grading option using Tele-BEARS through the end of the fifth week of instruction; students must meet with their Engineering Student Services Adviser in 230 Bechtel Hall to change their grading option during weeks 6-10"

So it seems that we need to go in and ask the counselors to change the grading.

The deadline to change the grading option is September 25th. You can still change it later, but you have to fill in a form and specify the reason why you want to change the grading option after the deadline. 

Source: http://registrar.berkeley.edu/Records/adddrop.html

children.subject:
You're correct. The College of Engineering has an earlier P/NP deadline. So this depends on whether you're EECS (sept 25) or LSCS.


Reference: http://registrar.berkeley.edu/Records/adddrop.html.

I'm afraid I don't know about the CoE form to change after the deadline, but if it's anything like L&S's, it would be quite difficult and definitely depend on exceptional circumstances.

Hey Anon, I'm in a similar situation but I emailed my advisor about it and this is the response:

Actually the deadline for students to change their grading option in a H/SS class is October 30, 2015. ENE RES C100 falls in this category. 

You should be good to take the midterm and then wait and see the results before changing the grading option. After next week though, you have to change it through the form (which is very easy if you're changing a grading option for a non-tech).

On that link I see that "Deadline to change grading option - students in Business, Environmental Design, Letters & Science, Natural Resources" is October 30, but for students in Engineering is September 25. Is there any reason for this discrepancy?

I was planning on choosing whether or not to P/NP my breadth classes after the first midterm (which is before oct 30 but after sept 25) and this seriously complicates things.

Also, it says for Engineering that if we P/NP after Sept 25, we "(Must submit Change Class Schedule Form to 230 Bechtel after this date)". Does anybody know how hard it is to change it with this change class schedule form?

history.content: If you're in the College of Engineering, it's Sept 25th.

children.subject: The deadline to change grading status for L&S students is the 10th week, so this option is still open for them.

Is there a reason why you can still change the grading option on CalCentral from grade to pnp? I'm trying to pnp an EE class, and so I changed my grading option and would have to fill out the form as well right? Is it too late to change?

history.content: I was wondering when the PNP deadline was for non-technical courses. Specifically, I am taking ERG C100 (an ethics and humanities class). Online, it says the deadline is September 25, but I heard this is only for technical classes? Does anyone know specifically about this class since I know there are quite a few EECS students taking it? Thanks.
history.subject: PNP Deadline for Classes
